actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday,the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.R. 2882 (Rep. Ciscomani):
        A bill to reauthorize the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

        -- Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate amendment.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of the House message to accompany H.R. 2882 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 78 - 18. Record Vote Number: 103 


        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882.

        -- Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senateamendment to H.R. 2882 presented in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1790) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations the House message to accompany H.R. 2882 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 1792) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lee to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1722) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lee to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1722) was not agreed to by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 51. Record Vote Number: 105 


        -- Motion by Senator Paul to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations with instructions to report back rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 106 


        -- Motion by Senator Cruz to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1804) made in Senate.

        -- Motion to table the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1804) was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 47. Record Vote Number: 107 


        -- Motion by Senator Tuberville to concur in the House amendment to the Senateamendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1781) made in Senate.

        -- Motion to table the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1781) was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 47. Record Vote Number: 108 


        -- Motion by Senator Schmitt to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1795) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schmitt to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1795) was not agreed to by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 109 


        -- Motion by Senator Johnson to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1706) made in Senate.

        -- Motion to table the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1706) was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 47. Record Vote Number: 110 


        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1713) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1713) was not agreed to by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1718) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1718) was not agreed to by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion by Senator Blackburn to refer to Senate Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report back rejected in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1794 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 111 


        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1793 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 112 


        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1792 (the instructions of the motion to refer)rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 113 


        -- Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senateamendment to H.R. 2882 withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1790) withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations the House message to accompany H.R. 2882 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 1792) withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Senate agreed to the House amendment to the Senate amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 74 - 24. Record Vote Number: 114 


        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.
 

 S.Amdt. 1722 (Sen. Lee):
        To prohibit Federal funding for the use of the CBPOne application to facilitate the entry of aliens into the United States.

        --Amendment SA 1722 proposed by Senator Lee.

        --Amendment SA 1722 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 51. Record Vote Number: 


 S.Amdt. 1790 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1790 proposed by Senator Schumer.

        --Proposed amendment SA 1790 withdrawn in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1791 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1791 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1790.

        --SA 1791 fell when SA 1790 was withdrawn.


 S.Amdt. 1792 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1792 proposed by Senator Schumer.

        --Proposed amendment SA 1792 withdrawn in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1793 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1793 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1792 (the instructions of the motion to refer).

        --SA 1793 fell when SA 1792 was withdrawn.


 S.Amdt. 1794 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1794 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1793.

        --SA 1794 fell when SA 1793 fell.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1713) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1713) was not agreed to by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1718) made in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Lankford to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1718) was not agreed to by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion by Senator Blackburn to refer to Senate Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report back rejected in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1794 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 111 


        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1793 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 112 


        -- Motion to table amendment SA 1792 (the instructions of the motion to refer)rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 113 


        -- Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to the Senateamendment to H.R. 2882 withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2882 with an amendment (SA 1790) withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations the House message to accompany H.R. 2882 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 1792) withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.

        -- Senate agreed to the House amendment to the Senate amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 74 - 24. Record Vote Number: 114 


        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.
 

 S.Amdt. 1706 (Sen. Johnson):
        To prohibit the disbursement of certain Federal funding to local jurisdictions that refuse to provide advance notice to theDepartment of Homeland Security regarding the release of illegal aliens from local custody.

        --Amendment SA 1706 proposed by Senator Johnson.


 S.Amdt. 1713 (Sen. Lankford):
        To prohibit the use of funds for the Women and Infants Hospital, Rhode Island.

        --Amendment SA 1713 proposed by Senator Lankford.

        --Amendment SA 1713 not agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.


 S.Amdt. 1718 (Sen. Lankford):
        To prohibit funding for the release of special interest aliens from Federal custody during such aliens' proceedings under the Immigration and Nationality Act.

        --Amendment SA 1718 proposed by Senator Lankford.

        --Amendment SA 1718 not agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.


 S.Amdt. 1722 (Sen. Lee):
        To prohibit Federal funding for the use of the CBPOne application to facilitate the entry of aliens into the United States.

        --Amendment SA 1722 proposed by Senator Lee.

        --Amendment SA 1722 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 51. Record Vote Number: 


 S.Amdt. 1781 (Sen. Tuberville):
        To prohibit funding for entities that permit certain students to participate in girls' or women's athletics.

        --Amendment SA 1781 proposed by Senator Tuberville.


 S.Amdt. 1790 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1790 proposed by Senator Schumer.

        --Proposed amendment SA 1790 withdrawn in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1791 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1791 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1790.

        --SA 1791 fell when SA 1790 was withdrawn.


 S.Amdt. 1792 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1792 proposed by Senator Schumer.

        --Proposed amendment SA 1792 withdrawn in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1793 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1793 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1792 (the instructions of the motion to refer).

        --SA 1793 fell when SA 1792 was withdrawn.


 S.Amdt. 1794 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Amendment SA 1794 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 1793.

        --SA 1794 fell when SA 1793 fell.


 S.Amdt. 1795 (Sen. Schmitt):
        To prohibit the use of funds to label speech as disinformation or misinformation or to coerce online platforms to alter, remove, restrict, or suppress speech.

        --Amendment SA 1795 proposed by Senator Schmitt.

        --Amendment SA 1795 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 51. Record Vote Number: 


 S.Amdt. 1804 (Sen. Cruz):
        To prohibit the use of funds to waive certain sanctions with respect to Iran.

        --Amendment SA 1804 proposed by Senator Cruz.




 H.Con.Res. 100:
        

        -- Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.


 S. 1258 (Sen. Ernst):
        A bill to require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to submit to Congress an annual report on projects that are over budget and behind schedule, and for other purposes.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S. 3613 (Sen. Peters):
        A bill to require Facility Security Committees to respond to security recommendations issued by the Federal Protective Service relating to facility security, and for other purposes.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- The committee substitute withdrawn by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 1818 (Sen. Peters):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 1818 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Peters.

        --Amendment SA 1818 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S.Res. 333 (Sen. Durbin):
        A resolution designating 2024 as the Year of Democracy as a time to reflect on the contributions of the system of Government of the United States to a more free and stable world.

        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 532 (Sen. Cornyn):
        A resolution recognizing and supporting the goals and ideals of National Medicolegal Death Investigation Professionals Week.

        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 625 (Sen. Brown):
        A resolution recognizing the week of March 17 through March 23, 2024, as "National Poison Prevention Week" and encouraging communities across the United States to raise awareness of the dangers of poisoning and promote poison prevention.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  2:29 a.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  5 p.m. on Tuesday, March 26, 2024.
